messages.body: Tesla Motors Inc (TSLA) Stock: Ignore The Analysts, Follow The Consumers $TSLA http://amigobulls.com/articles/tesla-motors-inc-tsla-stock-ignore-the-analysts-follow-the-consumers

links.title: Tesla Motors Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) Stock: Ignore The Analysts, Follow The Consumers
links.description: Only consumers understand Tesla Motors Inc. Analysts favor the old Ford and GM business models. Look at consumer behavior to invest in Tesla. There is a very good academic paper concerning how analysts' recommendations do not favor disruptive business models. There is a tendency for analysts to support existing technologies.

links.description: I recently read a book on daily fantasy sports. You know, like DraftKings. The goal is to make the best lineup you can for a group of games or event. That kind of stuff. One of the main takeaways was the biggest opportunities lie where there is a difference between the perception and reality of the upcoming game.

links.title: Tesla confirms Model 3 drive unit production at the Gigafactory, announces $350 million investment & 550 more jobs
links.description: While we already knew that Tesla was installing drive unit production lines at the Gigafactory, which was originally only supposed to produce battery packs, after the company's Vice-President of Engineering for Drive Systems got involved in the manufacturing at the plant and posted new jobs for the effort, Tesla officially confirmed last night that Model 3 drive unit production will happen in Nevada and revealed a few new details.

links.title: 2017 Will Be the Year Tesla Reigns Supreme-Or Finally Flops
links.description: In its first 13 years of its existence, Tesla Motors made some of the world's biggest, best-known companies look stuffy as it charged electric cars with sex appeal, built a zealous fanbase, set records for performance and quality, and even made its cars drive themselves-all the while dodging bankruptcy and even flirting with illegality to keep up its frenetic pace.

links.title: Tesla will make electric motors for the Model 3 at its Nevada gigafactory
links.description: Tesla will make electric motors for its new Model 3 sedan at its massive $5 billion factory in Nevada, Gov. Brian Sandoval said on Tuesday night, as the automaker prepares to start producing the mass market vehicle later this year.

links.title: Oil majors, car makers to push hydrogen technology to help cut emissions
links.description: DAVOS, Switzerland The heads of some of the world's biggest oil firms and automakers agreed on Tuesday to push for broader global use and bigger investments in using hydrogen to help reduce emissions and arrest global warming.

$TSLA This is called fast response! https://electrek.co/2017/01/17/tesla-walks-back-all-software-performance-reductions-max-power/

links.title: Tesla listens to customers and walks back all software performance reductions tied to frequent use max power
links.description: Last month, we reported on Tesla limiting the power output of its performance vehicles after frequent use of 'launch mode' and max power. It's something other sports car manufacturers do in order to prevent premature wear of components due to the high stress placed on them during those launches.
